Translations.Text: And We did not send down any army from heaven against his people, after him. And it was not necessary for Us to do that
It was not more than a single Mighty Blast (A powerful explosion), and look! They were (like ashes) put out (quiet) and silent
Ah! Sorrow on the part (My) servants! There has not come one messenger (of Allah) to them that they have not made fun of him
Do they not see how many of the generations before them We have destroyed? Verily, they (messengers) will not return to them
But each one of all of them (the generations)— Will be brought before Us (for Judgment)
And a Sign for them is (that when) the earth is dead: We give it life, and produce grain from it, from which you do eat
And We produce in it gardens with date trees and grapes (in vines that climb), and We cause springs to come from within it
That they may eat the fruits of this (gift from Allah) it was not their hands that made this (possible): Then will they not give thanks
Glory to Allah, Who created all the things in pairs that the earth produces, and also their own kind (also created in pairs) and (other) things about whom they do not know
And a Sign for them is the night: We withdraw from it the day, and look, they are thrown in darkness
And the sun moves along its way for a (length of) time set for him: That is the order of (Allah), the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the All Knowing (Al-Aleem)
And the moon— We have measured for it stages (to travel) till it comes back like the old (and worn out like the) lower part of a (crescent, dried out) date stalk
It is not allowed for the sun to overtake the moon, nor can the night overtake the day: Each (can only) stay on in (its own) path (according to the Order of Allah)
And a Sign for them is that We held together their race (through the Flood) in the loaded Ark (of Nuh, or Noah)
And We created for them similar (ships) on which they ride
If it was Our Will, We could drown them: (And) then there would be no helper (for them), nor could they be saved
Except as the part of Mercy from Us, and as a part of a few (worldly) things (for them) for a (little) while
And when it is said to them: "You fear that which has happened before you, and that which will come after you, so that you may (also) receive (Allah's) Mercy," (then they do not listen and go away)
From the many Signs (verses) of their Lord, there is not (even) one Sign (verse) that comes to them from which they do not turn away

And when they are told: "You spend from (the many gifts) that Allah has given to you;" The unbelievers say to those who believe: "Shall we really feed those (people) whom, if Allah had so willed, He (Himself) would have fed? You are in nowhere but in clear mistake
And they also ask: "When will this promise (be fulfilled), if you are truthful
They will not (have to) wait for anything, except a single Blast (A powerful explosion), it will catch (and grip) them while they are still quarreling among themselves
Then they will have no (chance by their own) will to settle (their affairs), and not (even) to return to their own people
And the Trumpet (a very loud instrument) shall be sounded, when (you will) see! From the graves (men) will come quickly forward to their Lord

They will say: "Ah! Sorrow to us! Who has raised us up from our place of sleep?" (A voice will say:) "This is what (Allah, Ar-Rahman) the Most Gracious had promised, and the word of the messengers was (really) true
It will be no more than a single Blast, so behold! They will all be brought up before Us
Then, on that Day, not (even) one soul will be unfairly treated in the least, and you shall be only given the (just) reward for your past actions
Surely, on that Day, the companions of the Gardens shall be busy and happy in everything that they do
They and their wives will be in the (cool) shade of thick trees, resting on thrones (of dignity)
There will be (every type of) fruit for them; They shall have whatever they want
(Their word will be), "Peace!" A Word (of greeting) from the Lord, Most Merciful (Raheem)
(To others, the word will be:) "And, you O criminals (the peoples of sin!) You get (yourselves) far away on this Day
Did I not command you? O! Children of Adam! That you should not worship Satan; Verily, he is to you an open enemy.—
And that you should worship Me (Allah); For, that is the Straight Path
And he (Satan) did take (you) a large number of you, (away towards evil). Then, did you not understand
This is the Hell of which you were promised (many times)
This Day, you burn (yourself in the Fire) because you rejected (the Truth many times)
This Day, We shall set a seal on the mouths. And their hands will speak to Us, and their legs will bear witness to all that they did
If it was Our Will, We could surely have wiped out (blinded) their eyes; So that they would have run about searching for the Path, but (then again) how could they have seen
And if it was Our Will, We could have transformed them (just to be) in their places; Then they would not have been able to forward (move about), and they could not have turned back
And if We gave long life to anyone, We would have reversed him in creation (by making him weak after giving him strength) then will they not understand
And We have not taught the (Prophet) poetry, and (poetry) is suited not for him: This is no less than a Message and Quran making things clear
(And also) that it may warn anyone (who is alive), and that its Word (Message) may be justified against the disbelievers
Do they not see that it is We Who have created from the (many) things that Our hands have fashioned for them— (Is also) cattle, for which they are the owners
And We have subdued them (the cattle) for their (use)? Of them some are for riding, and some they eat
And they have (other) benefits from them (the cattle), and they get (milk) to drink; Then will they not be thankful
And they take besides Allah, other false gods, (thinking) that they might be helped (by the false gods)
They (the gods) have not the power to help them: But they (the unbelievers) will be brought forward (for Judgment) as a (whole) group (to be punished)
So, do not let their (idle) talk, make you sad (O Prophet!). Surely, We know what they hide and what they say
Does man not see that it is We Who created him from (a clot in the) sperm-ovary drop? Yet see! He (makes himself) an open enemy
And he puts forth (and invents) comparisons for Us, and forgets his own (true origin of) Creation: (And) he says: "Who can give life to the bones after they have become rotten and turned to dust
Say: "He will give them (the bones) life (the One) Who created them for the first time! And He is All Knowing (Aleem) of every kind of creation
The same (Allah); He, Who produces fire out of the green tree, for you, who see! You may start a fire with it
Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create (another) like them? Yes indeed! (He can recreate them.) He is the Supreme Creator (Al-Khaliq), the All Knowing (Al-Aleem)
Surely, when He wants anything, His Command to it is, 'Be', and it is
So Glory be unto Him, in Whose hands is the kingdom of all things, and to Him all of you will be brought back
By those who arrange themselves in ranks (or rows, to serve and to worship Allah)
And by those who raise the clouds in a holy way, (to keep away the fears from the mind of humans)
And those who recite the Message (of Allah)
Surely! (And assuredly,) your Allah is One (Wah'id)
Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and all (that is) between them, and Lord of every point of the sun-rising, (that keeps changing every day of the year)
Verily, We have truly stored the lower heaven with beauty (of) the stars—
(For beauty) and for protection against every tough (unwilling and) revolting Satan
(So that) they (the Satans') should not try to hear from the direction of the Exalted Assembly (of men and angels in Allah’s service and worship) but (they) be thrown out from every side
Outcast (and unwelcome), they are under an everlasting penalty
Except such who may snatch something by stealing: And they are being followed by a flaming Fire of stabbing brightness

Then just ask (the disbelievers) what they think: Are they the more difficult to create, or the (other) creations whom We have created surely, We have created them (the disbelievers) out of a sticky clay
Nay! Do you wonder while they mock (and make fun of you and the Quran)
And when they are reminded, they pay no attention—
And when they see a Sign (from Allah), they mock at it
And they say: "This is nothing but evident magic
What!" (they ask), "When we are dead, and become dust and bones, shall we (then) be resurrected (raised up again)
And also our fathers from the old (days)
You say: "Yes, then you shall (also) be put to shame (because of your evil)
Then it will be a single (harsh) cry; And look, they will begin to see
They will say: "Woe (misery) to us! This is the Day of Judgment
(A voice will say:) "This is the Day of Sorting Out, whose Truth you denied (once)
(The angels will be told): "Bring (all of) you up (for Judgment); The wrongdoers and their companions; And the things they worshipped—
Besides Allah, and lead them to the way to the (burning) Fire
But stop them, verily, they must be asked
What is the matter with you, why do you not help each other (now)
No! But on that Day they shall submit themselves, (to the Judgment)
And they will turn to one another, and question one another
They will say: "It was you who used to come to us from the right hand (of power and authority)
They will reply: "No, you, yourselves were not believers
Also we did not have any authority over you. No, it was you who were a transgressing people
So now (this moment) has come true against us, the Word of our Lord that we shall really taste (the penalty of our sins)
We led you astray: Because, truly we were ourselves astray
Then truly, (on) that Day, they will (all) share in the Penalty
Surely, that is how We shall deal with the criminals (Al-Mujrimun)
Truly, when they were told that there is no god except Allah, they would fill themselves up with (false) pride
And they said: "What! Shall we give up our gods for the sake of a poet possessed?" (Referring to Prophet)
No, he (the Messenger) has come with the Truth, and he restates (the Message of) the messengers (before him)
Verily, you shall really taste the painful Penalty—
But it will be no more than the penalty for (the evil) that you have done —
Except the true (and loving) servants of Allah—
For them, their food (and provision) is known
Fruits (and Joys); And they (shall have) honor and dignity
In Gardens of (supreme) happiness
Facing each other on thrones (of dignity)
Around to them will be passed a Cup from a clear-flowing fountain
Crystal-white (and) of a delicious taste for those who drink (from it)
Free from all pains (and annoyances); They will not suffer intoxication (from it)
And beside them will be noble (and pure) women, holding back their looks, with big eyes (filled wonder and beauty)
As if they were (delicate) eggs closely guarded (from evil)
Then they will turn to one another and question one another
One of them will start the speak and say: "Verily, I had a close companion (on the earth)
Who used to say: 'What! Are you from those (people) who confirms the Truth (of the Message)
That when we die and become dust and bones, shall we really receive the rewards and punishments
(The speaker) said: "Would you like to look down
So he looked down and saw him (the questioner) in the middle of the Fire
He (the speaker) said: "By Allah! You brought me very close to ruin (in this Hell)
Had it not been for the Grace of my Lord, I would surely be among those brought (to Hell)
(The people of Paradise will say:) "Is it (true) that we will not die (again)
Except our first death, and that we shall not be punished
Surely, this is the supreme success (to be in the Paradise of joy)
For those who like (the state) this (joy) let (them) all work hard, (those) who wish to strive
Is that (the Paradise), the better place (of joy) or the (evil and wicked) tree of Zaqqum (in the Pit of Hell, see 37.64—)
Truly, We have made it (the evil tree of Zaqqum) a trial for the wrongdoers
Verily, it is a tree that comes out from the bottom of Hell-Fire
The buds of its fruit-stalk, come out of the stems; (They are) like the heads of Satans
Truly, they (the wrongdoers) will eat from there and fill their stomachs with it
Then on top of that they will be given a mixture made of boiling water
Then, thereafter, verily their return will be to the burning Fire of Hell
Truly, they found their fathers on the wrong path
So they (also) were rushed down after them (in their fathers evil footsteps)
And indeed, before them, many (people) from the olden days went astray—
And indeed, We sent (messengers) among them, to warn them—
Then see what was the end of those who were warned (but did not pay attention)—
Except the devoted (and loving) servants of Allah
And indeed, (in the old days), Nuh (Noah) cried to Us, and We are the best of those to answer him
And We rescued him, and his family from the great destruction (of the Flood)
And made his children (and descendants) to live (and stay on this earth)
And We left for him (this noble blessing) in the generations to follow in later times
Peace! (and greetings) to Nuh (Noah) among the (Our) Creation
Truly, like this do We reward those who do good
Verily, he (Nuh) was one of Our believing servants
Then We drowned the others (in the Flood)
And surely, among those who followed his (Nuh’s) way was Ibrahim (Abraham)
When he came to his Lord with a pure heart
When he said to his father and to his people, "What is it that, which you worship
Is it a lie, false gods other than Allah, that you want
Then what do you know about the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-Al-'Ala'meen)
Then he took a look at the stars
And he said, "I am truly sick (at my heart)
So they (his people) turned away from him, and left (him)
Then he turned to their gods and said: "Will you not eat (from what is offered to you)
What is the matter with you that you do not speak (and make sense)
Then he turned upon them (their gods), striking (them) with the right hand
Then (the worshippers) came with quick steps, and faced (him)
He said: "Do you worship what you have carved (yourselves)
While (it is) Allah (Who) has created you and (also) what you have made
They said: "Build for him a house (burning like a furnace), and throw him into the blazing fire
So (after having failed; See 21.69), they then took a way (to hurt) against him, but We made them the ones most ashamed
And he said: "Verily, I am going to my Lord! He will surely guide me
O my Lord! Grant me (a progeny) of the righteous
So, We gave him the good news of a boy ready (to be born) to suffer and be patient

And when (his son, Ismail) became (the age to) work with him, he (Ibrahim) said: "O my son! I see in a dream (vision) that I offer you in sacrifice (to Allah): Now see what is your (own) thought!" (The son) said: "O my father! Do like you are commanded: You will find me, if Allah so wills one who has (great) patience (and constancy)
Then, when they both had submitted their wills (to Allah’s Wish), and he (Ibrahim) had laid him (his son, Ismail) prostrate on his forehead (for sacrifice)
We called out to him, "O Ibrahim (Abraham)
You have already fulfilled your vision!"— Verily, thus We do reward those who do good
Indeed, it was clearly a trial (for Ibrahim)—
And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice (with that of a ram)
And We left for him (this blessing) in the generations to follow in later times
Peace be upon to Ibrahim (Abraham)
Verily, thus do We reward those who do good
Indeed, he was one of Our believing servants
And We gave him the good news of Ishaq (Isaac)— A prophet— One of the righteous
We blessed him and Ishaq (Isaac): And of their children (and descendants) are (some) who do right, and (some) who clearly do wrong to their own souls
And again, (from the past) We bestowed Our favor on Musa (Moses) and Haroon (Aaron)
And We saved them and their people from (their) great misfortune
And We helped them, so that they overcame (their troubles)
And We gave them the Book and Clear Scripture (Torah, which helps to make things clear)
And We guided them to the Straight Path
And We left for them (this blessing) in the generations to follow in later times
“Peace, be upon Musa (Moses) and to Haroon (Aaron)
Verily, thus do We reward those who do good
Indeed, they were two of Our believing servants
And verily, Ilyas (Elias) was one of Our messengers
When he said to his people: "Will you fear (Allah)
Will you call upon the false god (Baal) and give up the Best of Creators—
Allah— Your Lord and (Cherisher and) the Lord (and Cherisher) of your fathers from the earlier days
But they denied him, so they will be truly brought up (for punishment)—
Except the sincere and the devoted servants of Allah (among them)
And We left for him (this blessing) in the generations to follow in later times
Peace be upon those like Ilyas (Elias)
Verily, thus do We reward those who do good
Indeed, he was one of Our believing servants
And verily, Lut (Lot) was one of the messengers
Truly, We saved him and all his people (with him)
Except an old woman (his wife) who was with those who fell behind
Then We destroyed the rest
Surely, you pass by their (sites) by the morning—
And by night: Will you not reflect and understand
And verily, Yunus (Jonah) was one of the messengers
When he ran away (like a slave runs from captivity) to the ship (fully) loaded (with men and cargo)
Then he (agreed to foretell fortunes and) cast lots, (and he was blamed for the ships bad weather) and he was a loser, punished (and thrown in the sea)
Then the (big) fish swallowed him, and he had done actions worthy of blame (by running away from his mission)
If it was that he had not (repented and) glorified Allah
He would surely have remained inside the fish till the Day of Resurrection (to be raised from the dead)
But We cast (threw) him on the open shore while he was (still) sick
And We made a vine (of hard shelled fruit) to grow over him for shade
And We sent him to (teach Allah’s Message to) a hundred thousand (men) or more
And they believed; So We let them enjoy (their lives) for a while
Now ask them (the unbelievers) what they think: Is it that your Lord has (only) daughters, and they have sons
Or that We created the angels female, and they have seen (it)
Verily, is it not they who say (in their disbelief and), from their own lies and sayings
Allah has had children?" And verily, they are liars
Did He (then) choose daughters rather than sons
What is the matter with you? How do you decide
Then will you not remember (receive the warning)
Or do you have a clear authority
(If so), then you bring your Book (of authority) if you are truthful
And they have invented a blood-relationship between Him and the jinns', but the jinns' know (very well) that they (also) have to appear (for Judgment)
Glorified be Allah! (He is) Free from the things that they relate (to Him)
Except those slaves of Allah, whom He chooses
So surely, neither you nor those you worship—
Can lead (any of Allah’s servents) into temptation (and lies) about Allah
Except those who are (by themselves) going to the blazing Fire (of Hell)
(Those angels arranged in ranks to serve Allah say): "Not even one of us does not have a place appointed
And, verily we are surely arranged in ranks (for Allah’s Service)
And surely we are those who speak out (Allah’s Supreme) Glory
And indeed they (the pagan Arabs) used to say
If only we have had a Message before us from those (Books) of old
We would truly have been the Servants of Allah, sincere (and loving)
But (now that the Quran has come), they (still) reject it: But soon will they know (the penalty)
And surely, Our Word, already has been given before (this) to Our servants and messengers sent
That they would certainly be made victorious
And that Our forces— Surely, they would the be victors
So you (O Prophet!) turn away from them for a little while
And watch them (how they will do), and they shall soon see (how you do)
Do they really want to hurry Our punishment
Then when it (the punishment) falls into the open space before them; Painful will be the morning for those who were warned (but did not pay attention)
So you turn away from them for a little while
And watch them (how they will do), and they shall soon see (how you do)
Glorified be your Lord, the Lord of Honor and Power! (He is free) from the things that they relate (to Him)
And Peace (be) on the messengers (of Allah)
And all the Praises (and thanks) to Allah, the Lord (and Cherisher) of the Worlds (Rab-Al-'Ala'meen)
Sad: And the Quran, full of Guidance and Reminding (and Warning, this is the Truth)
No! Those who disbelieve are in arrogance and opposition (and think only about self-glory and separatism)
How many generations before them did We destroy? In the end, they cried but there was no more time (for them) to be saved
And they (pagans) are surprised that a warner (the Prophet) has come to them from themselves! And the unbelievers say: "This is a magician (with unusual powers and) telling lies
Has he (the warner) made (all) the gods into one god? Truly, this is a wonderful thing
And their leaders (the unbelievers) hurry away, (saying:) "You (also) walk away, and remain with your gods! Truly, this is a thing meant to be (against you)
We have never heard (anything like this) from the people of these latter days: This is nothing but an invention (made up story)
What!" (they say in anger), "Has a Message been sent to him (of all the persons) from us?"... But they are in doubt about Me (and My Message); No, but they have not yet tasted My punishment
Or do they have the wealth of the Mercy of your Lord- The Supreme in Power (Al-Aziz), the Bestower of Bounties without measure (Al-Wahhab)
Or have they the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all between? If so, let them reach up with the ropes and means (to get there)
But there- Even a large number of (their) allies will be defeated
Before them (there were many who rejected messengers of Allah)— The people of Nuh (Noah), and Ad, and Firon (Pharaoh), the lord of (wooden) poles, (to mark his empire)
And Samood (Thamud), and the people of Lut (Lot), and the companions of the Wood— Like this were the Confederates (the allies of unbelievers)
Not one (of them did anything) but denied the messengers, but My punishment came justly and surely (to them)
And these (people) only wait for a single Blast, which (is blown by Angel Israfil) will tolerate no delay
They (the unbelievers will) say: "Our Lord! Hasten our sentence (of punishment, even) before the Day of Reckoning (and account)
Have patience at what they say, and remember Our servant Dawood (David), the man of (great) strength; Verily, he always came back in repentance (to Allah)
Verily, We made the hills recite Our Praises together with him, in evening and at break of day
And all the birds gathered (in flocks), did turn (to Allah) with him (Dawood)
We made his kingdom strong and gave him wisdom, and good judgment in what he talked and what he decided
And, has the story of the (two) who disagreed reached you? When they climbed over the wall of the private room (where he prayed)

When they entered in presence of Dawood (David), and he was frightened of them, they said: "Fear not: We are two litigant (who disagree), one of us has wronged the other: Therefore, decide between us now with truth, and do not treat us with injustice, and guide us to the Right way

Verily, this man is my brother (in religion): He has ninety and nine ewes (female sheep), and I have (only) one: Yet he says; 'Leave her (the one sheep) to me,' and (also he) is rude to me when he talks

(Dawood) said: "Without a doubt he has done wrong to you by asking you for (the single) sheep to add to his (flock of) sheep: And truly, there are many partners (in business) who do wrong to each other, except those who believe and work deeds of righteousness do not act like that, and how few are they?"... And Dawood (David) gathered that We had tried him, and he asked forgiveness from his Lord, and he fell down, bowing (in prostration), and turned (to Allah in repentance)
So, We forgave him (for) this: And he really enjoyed an extreme closeness to Us, and a Beautiful Place of (final) Return

Oh Dawood (David)! Verily, We truly made you a successor and leader on earth: So you judge between men in truth (and justice): And do not follow the (idle) desires (of your heart), for they will take you away from the Path of Allah: Verily, those who go away from the Path of Allah, (there) is a painful penalty, because they forget the Day of Reckoning (and Account)

And We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between (them) without purpose. That is what the unbelievers thought. But warning (and sorrow) to the unbelievers because of the Fire (of Hell)

Shall We treat those who believe and do righteous good deeds in the same (way) as those who make (evil) mischief on earth? Or shall We treat those who are the pious and righteous, in the same (way) as those who turn away from right
(This is the Quran) a Book that We have sent to you full of blessings, so that they may (carefully) think about its Signs, and so that men of understanding may be remember
And to Dawood (David), We gave (his son) Sulaiman (Solomon)— Verily, he always turned (to Us) very well in Our service
When, in the evening, horses of the finest breeding, and quick in running, were brought before him

And he (Sulaiman) said: "Truly, I love the good things, in order to see the Glory of my Lord," until (the sun) was hidden behind the curtain of (dusk). [During this late Asr—Maghrib time (i.e., early—mid evening), Sulaiman used to pray to Allah
(Then, he said:) "Bring them (the horses) back to me." Then he began to pass his hand over (their) legs and their necks
And, indeed We did try Sulaiman (Solomon): We placed a body (without life) on his throne: (Like giving him power without giving him a soul) but he turned (to Us in true devotion)
He said: "O my Lord! Forgive me, and grant me a kingdom which may not suit another (king) after me: Verily, You are the Bestower (Al-Wahhab) of good things (without measure)
So, We made the Wind obey his power, to flow gently by his order, where ever he wanted—
And like this did (others obey his order); The Evil ones (Satans and jinns') of every kind of builder and diver—
As also others (obeyed his order those) tied together in chains
(Allah addressed Sulaiman and said:) "These are Our many gifts (of good things): Whether you (O Sulaiman!) give them (to others) or do not give them, no account will be asked
And truly, he enjoyed, an extreme closeness to Us, and (it is) a Beautiful Place of (final) Return
And remember (with honor) Our Servant Ayub (Job). When he cried to his Lord and said: "The Satan has hurt me with pain and suffering
(An order from Us was given:) "Strike your foot: This is where (water) is to wash, to cool, to refresh, and to drink
And We gave him (back) his people and doubled their number— As a Favor from Ourselves, and a thing to remember for all who have understanding

And take in your hand a little (bunch of thin) grass, and strike (your wife with) it: And do not break your promise." Truly, We found him (Ayub or Job) full of patience and constancy. How well in Our service did he ever return (to Us)
And remember (with honor) Our Servants Ibrahim (Abraham), Ishaq (Isaac), and Yaqoub (Jacob), those who had power and vision
Surely, We did choose them for a special (purpose)— Restating the Message of the Hereafter
And (in Our sight,) they truly were of the company of the chosen and of the Good
And remember (with honor) Ismail (Ishmael), Al-Yasa (Elisha), and Zul-kifl: Each of them was of the company of the Good
This is a Remainder (with guidance and warning): And surely, for the Righteous, is a Beautiful Place of (final) Return—
Paradise, (Gardens of Eternity), whose doors will (forever) be open to them
In there they will rest (in comfort) in there they can call for fruit in plenty, and (for delicious) drink
And beside them will be modest (and noble) women withholding their looks, (and companions) of equal age
This is the Promise made to you for the Day of Reckoning (and Account)
Truly like this will be Our Rewards (to you,) it (the Promise) will never fail—
Yes like this! And for those who do wrong the place of (their final) Return will be evil
Hell, is where they will burn in there, an evil bed (to lie on)
Yes like this! (And) then they shall taste it— A boiling fluid, and the murky discharge of dirty wounds
And other similar penalties of the same kind
(When they are taken to Hell)— Here is a group going straight with you! (There will be) no welcome (even in the Hell) for them! Truly, they shall burn in the Fire
(The followers of evil will cry out to their leaders:) No, you (too)! (There is) no welcome for you! It is you who have made this happen to us! Now, (this) place to stay-in is evil
They (the followers) will say: "Our Lord! Whoever has made this happen to us— Add a double penalty of Fire upon him
And they will (also) say: "What has happened to us that we see not men whom we used to count among the bad ones
Did we treat them with mockery, or have (our) eyes failed to see them
Truly, that is just and fitting— The charges made upon each other by the people of the Fire
(O Prophet) Say: "Truly, I am a warner: There is no god except Allah, the One and Only (Al-Wah'id), the Irresistible (Al-Qahhar)—
The Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and all that is between,— The Exalted in Might, (Al-Aziz), the Often Forgiving (Al-Ghafa’r)
Say: "That is a Message Supreme (above all)
From which you turn away
I have no knowledge about the high chiefs (angels), of the Exalted Assembly when they discuss (things) by themselves
Only this has been revealed to me: That I am to give (this) warning plainly and publicly
(Remember), your Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man from clay
So, when I have fashioned him and breathed into him, his soul, from My Spirit, then you (angels should) fall down (and prostrate) in respect for him
So, the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together
Except the Chief Satan: He was haughty, and became one of those who reject Faith
(Allah) said: "O Satan! What prevents you from prostrating yourself to the one whom I have created with Both My Hands? Are you proud (and haughty)? Or are you one of the high (and mighty) ones
(Satan) said: "I am better than him (Adam): You created me from fire, and You created him from clay
(Allah) said: "Then get yourself out from here: For verily, you are an outcast, rejected and accursed
And surely, My Curse shall be on you till the Day of Recompense (Judgment)
(Satan) said: "O my Lord! Then give me time (of relief) till the Day when the (dead) are Resurrected
(Allah) said: "Surely, then time is given to you—
Till the Day of the Time (which has been) appointed
(Satan) said: "Then by Your Power (and Permission) I will mislead them (men) all in the wrong (path)—
Except (those of) Your Servants amongst them (the men who are) sincere and purified (by Your Grace)
(Allah) said: "Then it is just and fitting— And I say what is just and fitting—
That I will surely fill Hell with you and those (men) who follow you, together
(O Prophet) say: "I do not want any reward from you for this (Quran), and I am not a pretender
This (Quran) is not less than a Remainder to (all) the Worlds
And you will surely know the truth of it (all) after a while
the Revelation of this Book is from Allah; The Almighty, (Al-Aziz, the One Exalted in Power), the All Wise (Al-Hakeem)
Surely, it is We Who have revealed (and made known) the Book to you in Truth: So, worship Allah, giving Him (your) sincere love and prayer

Surely, for Allah Alone is the truest religion (of love, worship and sincerity). But those who take for protectors other than Allah, (say): "We only worship them so that they may bring us closer to Allah." Truly Allah will judge between them where they differ. But Allah does not guide him who is a liar and ungrateful

If Allah had wished to take to Himself a son, He could have chosen whomever He pleased from those He creates: But Glory be to Him! (He is above such things.) He is Allah, the (Single) One (Al-Wah'id), the Compelling, (Al-Qahhar, Overpowering)

He has created the heavens and the earth in truth (and in proper proportions): He makes the night reach into the day, and makes the day reach into the night: He has subjected the sun and the moon follow (His law): Each one follows a path for a certain (preset) time. Verily, is He not the (One) Exalted in Power (Al-Aziz)— The Often Forgiving (Al-Ghafa’r)

He created (all of) you from a single person, then created, his mate of a similar nature; And He has sent down for you eight heads of cattle in (four) pairs (of sheep, goats, oxen and camels); He makes you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation (in stages one after another), in three covers (trimesters) of darkness. Such is Allah, your Lord (and Cherisher). To Him belongs (all) kingdom. There is no god but He: Why, then are you turned away (from Him)

If you reject, Allah, surely (He) does not have any need of you; But He does not like the thankless from His servants. And if you are thankful, He is pleased with you. No (human being who is a) bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another (human being). Then to your Lord is your Return, in the end, when He will tell you the truth of all that you did (in this life). Verily, He knows well all that is in (everyone's) hearts

And when some trouble comes to man; He cries to his Lord, turning to Him (the Lord) by feeling sorry for what he has done: But when He gives him (the man, a gift) of Mercy from Himself, (man) forgets what he cried and prayed for before, and he sets up rivals to Allah, so as to mislead others from His (Allah’s) Path. Say (to such people): "Enjoy your disbelief for some time: Surely, you are from the companions of the Fire

Is one who is obedient (to Allah) with love and sincerity in the hours of the night prostrating himself or standing (up in love and admiration), who pays attention to the Hereafter, and who places his hope in the Mercy of his Lord, (like one who does not)? Say: "Are those equal, those who know and those who do not know?" It is those who have understanding that receive guidance

Say: "O you my (people!) Servants who believe! Fear your Lord, for those who do good in this world, (the Reward) is good. Spacious is Allah’s earth! Those who patiently work hard will truly receive a reward without measure
Say: "Surely, I am commanded to worship Allah with all my sincere love, servitude and prayer (to Him)
And I am commanded to be the first of those who bow to Allah in Islam
Say: "If I disobeyed my Lord, I would truly have fear of the penalty of a Mighty Day
Say: "It is Allah Alone (Whom) I worship, with all my sincere love, servitude and payer (to Him)

So you worship whatever you will besides Him." Say: "Truly, those in loss (now) are those who (will) lose their own souls and their people on the Day of Judgment: Verily! That is truly the (greatest and) real Loss
They shall have layers of Fire over them, and layers (of Fire) below them: With this, Allah does warn His servants: "Oh My Servants! Then you fear Me
Those who avoid evil— And do not fall into its worship— And turn to Allah (in repentance), for them are the glad tidings and good news so announce the good news to My servants—
Those who listen to the Word, and follow the best (meaning) in it: Those are the ones whom Allah has guided, and those are the ones blessed with understanding
Then, is the one against whom the judgment of punishment is justly due (equal to one who avoids evil)? Then, would you save one who is in the Fire

But the high palaces (to live in) have been built one above another, for those who fear their Lord; Beneath them rivers (of joy) flow: (This is) the Promise of Allah, and He never fails in (His) Promise

Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky, and leads it (the rain water) through springs in the earth? Then from it, He makes produce of various colors to grow: Then it fades (due to lack of water): (And) you will see it grow yellow; Then He makes it dry up and fall down. Truly, in this, there is a Message to remember for men of understanding

Is one whose breast Allah has opened to Islam, so that he has received the Light from his Lord, (not better than one whose heart is in disbelief)? (There is) grief for those whose hearts are hardened against saying the Praises of Allah! They are clearly walking about in error

Allah has sent down (from time to time) the Most Beautiful Message, in the form of a Book, (the Scripture, this Quran) true within (and to) itself, (always) repeating (its teaching): The skins of those who fear their Lord shiver and tremble by (reading and hearing) it; Then their skins and their hearts soften by to the remembrance of Allah. Like this is the Guidance of Allah. He guides like this whom He pleases, but no one can guide those whom Allah leaves to wander about

Then, is the one who has to fear the hurt of the penalty on the Day of Judgment (and receive it) on his face, (like one who is safe from it)? And it will be said to the wrongdoers: "You taste (the fruits of) what you earned
(There were) those who rejected (the Message) before them and so (for them) the punishment came to them from directions they did not expect
So, Allah gave them a taste of hurt (and disgrace) in the present life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew
And indeed, in this Quran, We have put forth every kind of similar (and meaningful) story for men in order that they may be informed (and warned)
(It is purely) a Quran in Arabic, without any (dishonesty or) crookedness in it: In order that they (those who read) may protect (themselves) against evil

Allah puts forth a parable (the story with meaning and guidance in it)— A slave belonging to many different partners, (false gods) disputing with one another and a slave belonging only to one master : Are those two equal in comparison? All the Praises (and thanks) be to Allah! But most of them do not know
Truly, you will die (one day), and truly they will also die (one day)
Then in the End, you will (all) on the Day of Judgment, settle your disagreements in the Presence of your Lord
